content.description: Start standing up and work your way up the side of the boulder to a top out.
content.location: Once you arrive in the Sand Hill area the problem is on the backside of the big boulder on your right.

content.description: Fun warm up route. Start standing up and pull yourself and work your way up the crack to a top out.
content.location: As you are leaving the bouldering area on the Sand Hill Trail it is on your left. Directly across from large lone boulder on your right.

content.description: Start on the left side of the big boulder and traverse yourself across the face of the rock. This requires good footwork, finger jams, and presses. After traversing across, work yourself up the face of the wall to a top out. Patience is required to complete this route.
content.location: This will be the first big boulder you come to while following the Sand Hill Trail.

content.description: Pretty simple first couple moves into the crux at the top. Problem is pretty dirty right now, definitely needs some cleaning up.
content.location: Follow the Sand Hill approach until you reach the first boulder on your left. The start is on the right side of the boulder. Same boulder shared with Chestnut Traverse and Get Skinny.

content.description: Easy and fun warm up traverse across the boulder to a top out.
content.location: Walk all the through the Sand Hill climbing area. The start this problem is the last boulder on your left.

content.description: Climb straight up the problem. Problem is very mossy and dirty which makes footwork a little sketchy. Should clean up once climbed more though.
content.location: Walk around the left side of the large boulder on the right side of the trail. Problem is left of Zlatan.

content.description: Start at the far end of the wall and traverse to the left. Crux is the down climb underneath the large fallen tree then to the top.
content.location: Right side of the wall with the large fallen tree on it.

content.description: Start standing up and move up and to the right. Grab the large horn and proceed to top out.
content.location: Walk around to the right side of the large boulder in the Sand Hill area. The start will be right there.

content.description: You have to get skinny around the little tree. Start low and work left to a top out.
content.location: First problem to your left after you pass “Briar Patch”. It is along side the trail.

content.description: Start standing up, work your way up the problem with small finger crimps to the top out.
content.location: When you arrive in Sand Hill Bouldering area the problem will be on the right side of the trail in the middle of the largest boulder in this area.

content.description: Stand up start, the crux is the next move which is holding onto the sloper and then grabbing a little knob. Then you will have to almost mantle yourself onto the big sloper and then it is an easy top out from there.
content.location: Once you arrive at Sand Hill climbing location you will come to a large stand alone boulder. The start to this problem is directly across from this large boulder.

content.description: Same start as Chiksika direct but instead of making the finals moves to the top out traverse right for a few tricky moves to the top out.
Start low and climb directly up the face to a top out.
content.location: This problem starts on the left side of the wall with the large fallen tree on it.

content.description: Start standing up, move from right to left to a top out. The crux is within the first couple moves when you down climb across the face.
content.location: As soon as you arrive at the Sand Hill Bouldering area the problem is the first boulder on the left side of the trail.

content.description: Sit start to a direct climb up good pockets and jugs. Watch out for briers on the top out.
content.location: This is the first boulder to the left before entering the Sand Hill area.

content.description: Crux is after you come out of the start and grab the jug with your right and big palm side pull with your left. Pull feet up over the lip, traverse left and go int it start of bloody arm
content.location: Start is to the left of bloody arm by the indent on the slab wall. There is a crimp for your left hand, good side pull for your right hand. Left foot goes into a small half dollar sized indentation towards the bottom of the lip, either toe or heel hook out by your right hand

content.description: Start standing with left hand on side pull and right hand in the little pocket. Work your way straight up the problem. Using little crimps and slopers. Footwork is super important for this slab problem.
content.location: When you arrive in Sand Hill bouldering area. Walk about 15 yards and the problem will be in the middle of the long boulder on your left.

content.description: Shaded and secluded area, few established bouldering problems with opportunity for a lot more. Rock quality is hit or miss and made up of mostly sandstone.
